channel.title: [PI] Server Help
channel.description: Hello, well i've being trying to get my Rsps online but i've being haveing some problems. I changed the ip in client.java that all went fine, my cache up downloads. But what do i do to my source because when i run my source [IMG]http://i48.tinypic.com/w5t0n.png[/img] i get that do i have to change any of the ports or add an ip anywhere in the source my i use a thomson tg585 modem. So if i send my source to any of my friends they will be able to log on and see me, because once i set this up and send my friend the client what do i do after that? I will rep ++ and i will give you co-owner if you help me alot. Thank you. I've set the client up it's perfect i just need to set my source up.

item.dc:creator: @smdson smdson
item.description:

if you have skype mayby i can help -add up if so codythepr0

item.title: [PI] Server Help
item.dc:creator: @ravekitty ravekitty
item.description:
@ravekitty wrote:

Saige:

Ohhhhh, So in my client.java i can’t just put my own ip not a no-ip one. I know there are alot of chances of getting ddosed an all but i can try the no-ip one if you want.

Personally, I think you have about a 2% chance of even getting ddosed.
I don’t really believe it exists as people say,
anyways. You can use either.
I’d use no-ip though. just incase :}

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Server Help
item.dc:creator: @ravekitty ravekitty
item.description:
@ravekitty wrote:

Saige:

Ok, i’ve already changed the ip of my client.java in the client folder what do i do to the source file now? I need to know if i change any ips or ports in the source folder Can i skype with you or team view and you can show me?

I don’t like using teamview/skype.
lolol
anyways, What ip did you put in client.java?
Make sure it’s exactly what you made on no-ip.
Assuming you made one\using it.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Server Help
item.dc:creator: @ravekitty ravekitty
item.description:
@ravekitty wrote:

Saige:

Nothing i want to know if i have to change anything to make my server online? like where it says 0.0.0.0 do i change that to my ip? or what do i do to make it connect to my friends client

I didn’t realize you were looking on the server side >_<
Go to the client sided CLIENT.java
and find the ip ;p

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Server Help
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

Don’t change ANYTHING server side… This is the second time Ive said this today lol, don’t touch the server, it just sits and waits for client connections to be made…
